Literature Review: The human microbiome, a complex ecosystem of microorganisms residing within and on the human body, plays a crucial role in maintaining health and has been implicated in various diseases. Recent advances in high-throughput sequencing technologies have enabled researchers to characterize the microbiome with unprecedented detail, leading to a surge in microbiome-related studies. This literature review aims to provide an overview of the most common techniques used to describe microbial communities, the unique challenges associated with using the microbiome in biomedical data science, and successful approaches to overcome these challenges.
